items.title: Sonoma County Supervisors require employee vaccinations or testing
items.summary: The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors today approved a policy requiring all county employees to either show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or submit to weekly testing.

items.title: Eighty percent of eligible Sonoma County residents are now at least partially vaccinated against COVID-19
items.summary: While COVID hospitalizations continue to increase, four out of five eligible Sonoma County residents are now either fully or partially vaccinated against COVID-19, Sonoma County Department of Health Services leaders reported to the Board of Supervisors today as part of an update on the County’s pandemic response.

items.title: Sonoma County expands testing options, shifts focus to PCR tests
items.summary: In response to growing demand for testing amid the current surge of COVID cases, the Sonoma County Department of Health Services has greatly expanded testing opportunities through private providers while freeing County Health to focus instead on outbreak and surveillance testing.

items.title: Request for Proposal: COVID-19 Emergency Solutions Grants (ESG-CV) funds for Rapid Rehousing (RRH) and Emergency Shelter (ES) projects
items.summary: As you are aware, ESG-CV funds can only be used “to prevent, prepare for, and respond to coronavirus, among individuals and families who are homeless or receiving homeless assistance and to support additional homeless assistance and homelessness prevention activities to mitigate the impacts created by coronavirus under the Emergency Solutions Grants program

items.title: Bodyfeeding and Human Milk? This is an opportunity to become more inclusive.
items.summary: Learn more about inclusive language, effective pumping, continuity of care, safe sleep and mental health with these breast/chestfeeding articles and webinars.

items.title: County to require proof of vaccination for emergency personnel, encourages employers to do the same
items.summary: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations, Sonoma County today issued a health order calling for all fire, law enforcement and emergency medical service workers and staff at disaster shelters to show proof of vaccination.

items.title: Combo Feeding - Word on the Street is Rates Are Up.
items.summary: Has the stress of COVID-19 lowered exclusive breastfeeding rates? Or is it a lack of support? Or something else altogether?

items.title: Request for Proposals (RFP) for Substance Use Disorder Services
items.summary: The County of Sonoma is pleased to invite you to respond to a Request for Proposals for Substance Use Disorder Services.

items.title: Sonoma County partners with private providers to expand COVID-19 testing opportunities
items.summary: Due to increasing case rates and testing demand, the Sonoma County Department of Health Services is partnering with four trusted providers - Curative, LHI, Molecular Matrix, and Fox Home Health - to offer expanded COVID-19 testing services for Sonoma County residents.

items.title: Bay Area Health Officials Urge Immediate Vaccination and Issue Orders Requiring Use of Face Coverings Indoors to Prevent the Spread of COVID-19
items.summary: Vaccination continues to protect against severe COVID-19 illness, but with the COVID-19 Delta variant now infecting a small percentage of vaccinated people as well as many unvaccinated people, eight Bay Area health officers have issued Health Orders requiring masks indoors in public places.

items.title: Sonoma County achieves 70 percent COVID-19 vaccination rate, but cases continue to climb among unvaccinated residents
items.summary: Sonoma County achieves 70 percent COVID-19 vaccination rate, but cases continue to climb among unvaccinated residents

items.title: Get vaccinated and receive free admission to Summer Fun Fest at Sonoma County Fairgrounds
items.summary: The Sonoma County Fairgrounds and the Sonoma County Medical Association are collaborating with the County’s vaccination efforts by providing free admission and a free ride ticket to members of the public who receive a COVID-19 vaccine at the Jockey Club in Santa Rosa.

items.title: Supervisor Coursey on the Latest Surge of COVID-19 Delta Variant
items.summary: As of July 21 Sonoma County’s daily transmission rate of COVID-19 is 9 new infections per 100,000 people and 48 COVID patients were being treated at area hospitals. These numbers represent the biggest local surge of the pandemic since March of this year. Nine COVID-related deaths were reported in July compared to just one death recorded in the month of May.

items.title: The Public Health Threat of Health Misinformation
items.summary: Should Social Media Use be a Health Vital Sign? Recommendations for Health Practitioners from the Surgeon General.
tags: Sonoma County Maternal Child and Adolescent Health
